title: Splash Page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user MLB Play app open 
AND User not Logged in

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user is not logged in / or freshly installed the app
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should see a splash page that asks user to Log In or Sign Up 
Things to be displayed
* MLB Play logo
* 'Log in with MLB' button
* 'Don't have an account? Sign Up'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user is logged in
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN bypass the splash page and send user back to the home page (Games Tab)

title: Sign Up page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play app installed on Device
AND user goes through the Sign up flow

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the sign up page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with
* title “Sign Up” 
* back arrow in the top left corner
* copy 'Join the fun of MLB Play with a FREE MLB account.' 
* '*Please fill in the required fields.' copy
* An email text field with 
* A Nickname text field 
* A password field
* A Birthdate MM/DD/YYY text field with 
* A Country of Residence field
* 'If your country is not listed, choose "Other"' copy underneath the Country of Residence field
* Legal copy 'By signing up, I acknowledge that I have read, understand, and agree to be bound by MLB Play’s Official Rules, MLB's Terms of Use and MLB’s Privacy Policy. 
* A greyed out sign up button
* Already have an account? Log In. Log In is a link

AND all fields have an asterisk

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on Official Rules
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Official Rules page opens in a webview

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on Terms of Use
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Terms of Use Agreement page opens in a webview

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on Privacy Policy
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN MLB Privacy Policy page opens in a webview

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters the information in all the fields
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Sign Up button becomes blue and active

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on Log In
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Log In page opens

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on back arrow
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the welcome page opens

title: Sign Up - Email field
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play app installed on Device
AND user goes through the Sign up flow

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters an Invalid email
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the line is turned red with the text “Please enter a valid email address”

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters Latin symbols
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the line is turned red with the text “Please enter a valid email address”

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user puts the space
custom_steps_separated.expected: THE the error message appears: 'The first character must be a letter or number'

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user enters a valid email

valid emails include:

user@gmail.com
user+@gmail.com
user-@gmail.com
user?@gmail.com
user=/-+@gmail.com
user%20@gmail.com
andi2019p@mlb.com
custom_steps_separated.expected: WHEN the field accepts the email and throws no error message

title: Sign Up - Nickname
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play app installed on Device
AND user goes through the Sign up flow
custom_steps: WEHN User on Nickname field during the Sign Up
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to enter nickname ( 6-15 Character / Letter and numbers only) 



If User leave empty or does not met requirement - User should display with enter valid nickname) 

iOS - Nickname must be 6-15 character long 
Android - First we display message - 6-15 Character 
If User enter special character then display message - only letters and numbers

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the Nickname field
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN nickname criteria should be: 

* nicknames should not be unique
must be 6-15 characters long
* must contain only letters and numbers
* can not contain spaces and special characters
* can not contain non-English characters
* can not be disruptive or offensive
* can not contain emoji

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters nickname that is shorter than 6 characters or longer than 15
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should see the error message


iOS - Nickname must be 6-15 character long 
Android - First we display message - 6-15 Character

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters nickname with special character
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should see the error message 'Nickname mush contain only letters and numbers

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters disruptive or offensive nickname
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should see the error message 'Please choose another nickname'

title: Sign Up - Password
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play app installed on Device
AND user goes through the Sign up flow

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is creating a password
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will see the following password requirements and must make a password fitting the following password requirements:
 - No special characters
 - One number
 - One uppercase letter
 - One lowercase letter
 - 8-15 characters

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters an invalid password
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the corresponding issues with the password should be red with an X in the requirements field

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters a valid password
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN all the password requirements should have a check mark next to them

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks the eyeball after entering a password
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the text in the password field should become visible

title: Sign Up - Birthdate
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play app installed on Device
AND user goes through the Sign up flow

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the Birthdate field
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should see:
* the field placeholder iOS: 'Birthdate MM/DD/YYYY'
Android: Birthdate

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters a future birthdate
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is displayed with “Please enter a correct birthdate” message

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters an invalid birthdate
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is displayed with: 'Please enter your birthday in the format mm/dd/yyyy' message

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters a birthdate which is under 21
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with: 'You must be at least 21 years of age to access MLB Play.'
AND 'Sign Up' button stays diactivated

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters a birthday which is 21+
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN no error message should appear
AND user should be able to continue the sign up flow

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters year older than 122 years
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user receives an error message 'Please enter a correct birthdate'

title: Sign Up - Country of Residence
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play app installed on Device
AND user is going through the Sign Up flow

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the 'Country of Residence' field
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user sees 'Country of Residence' inside the field
AND 'Country of Residence' is not pre-filled
AND copy 'If your country is not listed, choose “Other”' is displayed underneath the text field

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on that field
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 'Country of Residence' moved to the top borderline
AND drop down list appears

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user scrolls through the drop down list
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with a drop-down list with the following countries in order:

United States
Australia
Canada
China
Colombia
Cuba
Dominican Republic
France
Germany
India
Israel
Italy
Japan
Mexico
Netherlands
Panama
Puerto Rico
South Korea
Taiwan
United Kingdom
Venezuela
Other

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selects Canada
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN an additional drop-down field is displayed (separate TC)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selects any other country
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN no additional drop-down field is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selects Country of Residence
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Sign Up button gets active

title: Sign Up - Province
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play app installed on Device
AND user is going through the Sign Up flow
AND user selected Canada as Residence

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selects Canada
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN an additional drop-down field is displayed asking them to declare their Province (listed in alphabetical order)

Alberta
British Columbia
Manitoba
New Brunswick
Newfoundland and Labrador
Northwest Territories
Nova Scotia
Nunavut
Ontario
Prince Edward Island
Quebec
Saskatchewan
Yukon

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selects a province
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Sign UP button gets active

title: EC - existing email
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play app installed on Device
AND user has an MLB account
custom_steps: WHEN user tried to Sign Up with an existing account (e-mail address)
custom_expected:
THEN user is not able to SIgn Up 
AND error message is displayed 'An account has already been created with that email address. If this account belongs to you, please log in to access your account or update your information and preference.'

title: Favorite Team
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB  Play app installed on Device
AND user is going through Sign Up flow

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the favorite team selection page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with:

* 'Favorite Team' title
* copy 'Select your favorite team.
You can change at any time.'
* Grid of all teams with their logos and names (make sure logos and names are up to date)
* 'Next' button (disabled)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selects a team
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN selected team has a white border 
AND 'Next' button is enabled

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on 'Skip'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is brought to the Games tab

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user selects the team
AND user clicks 'Next'
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is brought to the Games tab
AND selected favorite team is displayed in user's avatar and wallpaper

title: Notification page - iOS
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play app installed on Device
AND user goes through the Sign up flow
AND user is on Notification page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the Notification page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should be displayed with

* title “Notifications” 
- picture/icon in the middle of the screen
- below the picture should be the message “MLB Play uses push notifications to notify you of available games, important updated, and your scores.”
- and there should be a clickable "Enable In Settings" and "Skip this for now" buttons

custom_steps_separated.content: If user clicks on 'Enable Notifications'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is taken to device settings - MLB Play

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user click 'Skip for now'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is brought to the Games tab in the app

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enables notification in device settings
custom_steps_separated.expected: WHEN user goes back to the app, user sees the copy 'Notifications are enabled. You'll be notified of available games, important updates, and your scores.'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user disables notification in device settings
custom_steps_separated.expected: WHEN user goes back to the app, user sees the copy 'Notifications are disabled. MLB Play uses push notifications to notify you of available games, important updates, and your scores.'

title: App Tracking Transparency for new users
custom_preconds: GIVEN MLB Play app installed on Device

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user Signs Up to the app
AND is on the EULA page (Agree to Term page)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the App Tracking Transparency (ATT) is prompt 

Things to display: 
* title 'Allow "MLB Play" to track your activity across other companies' apps and websites?'
* copy ' This allows MLB PLay to provide you with a more personalized playing experience
* Ask App not ot Track 
* Allow

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks 'Allow'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Allow Tracking switch should be ON

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks 'Ask App not to Track'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Allow Tracking switch should be OFF

title: Sign Up flow
custom_preconds: GIVEN MLB Play app installed on Device

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user opens the MLB PLay app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user sees the splash page (separate TC)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on 'Sign Up' or 'Don't have an account? Sign Up' links
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is displayed with 'Sign Up' page (separate TC)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on back arrow
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is brought to the splash screen

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters information in all fields and clicks in 'Sign Up' button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is displayed with the Notification page (separate TC)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selects the notification option
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is displayed with 'Select Your Favorite Team' page (separate TC)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selects their favorite team and clicks 'Next'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is brought to the Games tab

title: Sign Up - error messages
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play app installed on Device
AND user goes through the Sign up flow

custom_steps_separated.content: WEHN user enters an invalid email address in Email Address field
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should be displayed with an error message 'Please enter a valid email address'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters an invalid Nickname
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should be displayed with an error message 'Nickname must be 6-15 characters long'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters Password on the Password field
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should be displayed with checkmark against the requirement for the password 

Note: All option are displayed below the Password and user will display with Red color for invalid entries and checkmark filled with white background for the valid entry

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters an invalid Password and clicks on another text field
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should be displayed with an error message 'Your password does not meet the requirement'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters a password of less than 8 characters or more than 15 characters
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should be displayed with an error message 'Password is not between 8 and 15 characters'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user is on Birthdate field and enters a birthday > 21 year old
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should be displayed with 'You must be at least 21 years of age to access MLB Play'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user is on Birthdate field and enters a future date
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should be displayed with an error message 'You must be at least 21 years of age to access MLB Play'

title: Login UI
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play app installed on Device
AND user goes through the Log In flow
custom_steps:
[Android] WHEN user taps 'Log in with MLB' link
OR
[iOS] WHEN user taps 'Log in with another MLB account' link
custom_expected:
THEN Log In screen is displayed:
* Email textfield
* Password textfield
* Log In button

Don't have an account? Sign Up link (iOs/Android)
Forgot Password? link (ANDROID) (Above the copy of TOS and PP and Log In)
Forgot Password? (iOS) - (Above the copy of TOS and PP and Log In)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user is viewing the Log In page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with
* "Log In" title
* copy 'Join the fun of MLB Play with your MLB account.'
* Email Address fiend
* Password field
* copy 'By logging in, I agree to MLB Play’s Official Rules, MLB's Terms of Use and MLB’s Privacy Policy.'
* 'Forgot Password?' link
* 'Log In' button (grayed out)
* 'Don't have an account? Sign Up'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on Official Rules link
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is displayed with Official Rules in a webview

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on Terms of Use link
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is displayed with Terms of Use in a webview

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on Privacy Policy link
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is displayed with Privacy Policy in a webview

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user viewing the Log In page
And taps the text entry fields
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the keyboard will slide up into view
[iOS] AND tapping anywhere will dismiss the keyboard
[Android] AND tapping the device bottom nav downarrow will dismiss the keyboard

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user is viewing the Log In page
And taps the on Sign Up link
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the view will transition to the Sign Up page

title: 'Forgot Password?' link
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the MLB Play app on device 
AND the user has existing account
AND the user is on Log In page
custom_expected: THEN Reset Password Page is shown allowing user to reset their password

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is viewing the Reset Password page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN Reset Password will be shown as the title with a back navigation arrow
AND beneath the header there is text to instruct the user to reset password
* [Android] - Forgot Password 

Recover your Account
"Email Address field . We'll send you an email with a link to reset your password."
* [iOS] - Then user display with Web url https://www.mlb.com/forgot-password

for reseting the password 

Forgot Password 
Please enter your e-mail address below and we'll send a link to reset your password.
Email field 
Reset Password radio button
AND an email field is shown above 'Submit' button

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN email address input field is unpopulated
and the "submit" button is tapped
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN an error prompt is shown
* [Android] "Reset Password Failed." - "Please enter a valid email address." (this is within the app) 
* [iOS] - Open Web link to fill the form

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps "OK" on error prompt
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Reset Password page is shown as the title with a back navigation arrow

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters an Email address that does not conform to standard email rules (i.e @ symbol missing, domain missing)
AND taps the Submit Button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN an error prompt is shown
* [Android] "Reset Password Failed." - "Please enter a valid email address."
* [iOS] - TODO: CONFIRM

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps "OK" on error prompt
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Reset Password page is shown as the title with a back navigation arrow

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user disables the network (setting device to airplane mode is one way to achieve this)
WHEN the user is viewing the Reset Password page
AND the user enters an Email address that does confirm to standard email rules (i.e example@example.com)
AND taps the Submit Button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN an error prompt is shown
* [Android] "Reset Password Failed." - "Password recovery failed."
* [iOS] - TODO: CONFIRM

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps "OK" on error prompt
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Reset Password page is shown as the title with a back navigation arrow

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user enables the network
WHEN the user is viewing the Reset Password page
AND the user enters an Email address that does confirm to standard email rules (i.e example@example.com)
AND taps the Submit Button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN Reset Password page is shown as the title with a back navigation arrow
AND the email field and submit are no longer shown, INSTEAD is shown "Reset password instructions have been sent to your email."

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user accesses their email containing a Reset Password link
AND user completes needed actions to successfully reset the password
AND user returns to MLB PREDICT app (Reset Password page, if prev minimized)
AND user logs in with new password
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is logged in successfully with newly reset password.

title: App Tracking Transparency for existing users
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play app installed on Device
AND user created a profile in MLB.com and never logged in MLB Play app

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user log in to the app for the first time
AND is on the EULA page (Agree to Term page)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the App Tracking Transparency (ATT) is prompt 

Things to display: 
* title 'Allow "MLB Play" to track your activity across other companies' apps and websites?'
* copy ' This allows MLB PLay to provide you with a more personalized playing experience
* Ask App not ot Track 
* Allow

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks 'Allow'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Allow Tracking switch should be ON

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks 'Ask App not to Track'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Allow Tracking switch should be OFF

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user closes the app and logs back in
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the App Tracking Transparency (ATT) is  not prompt

title: iOS keychain functionality
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user has no other MLB apps on device
AND user downloads MLB Play app

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user opens the MLB Play app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN there should be a “Log in with MLB” button on the login screen

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user is logged in in another MLB app on their device
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user’s email address is shown, and the “Continue with MLB” button is added that allows them to continue their log in.

'Log In with another MLB account' is displayed
'Don't have an account? Sign Up' is displayed
('Log In' and 'Sign Up' are light bold)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on 'Continue with MLB' button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is able to proceed to the app using their account

title: iOS - EC - Keychain Functionality
custom_preconds: GIVEN user freshly installs the MLB Play app

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN opens the app
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THE user is displayed with 

* 'Log In with MLB'
* 'Don't have an account? Sign Up'

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user logs in 
AND logs out 
AND logs back in
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user's account is saved into keychain and user is displayed with

* previously logged in account
* 'Continue with MLB' CTA
* 'Log In with another MLB account'
* ' Don't have an account? Sign Up'

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user is logged in to other MLB apps on device
AND freshly installs MLB app
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user's account is saved into keychain and user is displayed with

* logged in account from another MLB app
* 'Continue with MLB' CTA
* 'Log In with another MLB account
* ' Don't have an account? Sign Up'

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user is logged in to other MLB apps on device
AND freshly installs MLB PLay app
AND user updates the password in mlb.com
AND opens the MLB Play app
AND user clicks on 'Continue with MLB' CTA
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with

* 'Please enter a valid email/password error message* 'Log In with another MLB account'
* ' Don't have an account? Sign Up'

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user is logged in in MLB Play
AND user updates the password in mlb.com
AND opens the MLB Play app
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with

* 'Please enter a valid email/password error message* 'Log In with another MLB account'
* ' Don't have an account? Sign Up'

title: Update Your Account - Province
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play app installed on Device
AND user is going through the Log In flow
AND user is on the 'Update Your Account' page
AND user selected Canada as Residence

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selects Canada
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN an additional drop-down field is displayed asking them to declare their Province (listed in alphabetical order)

Alberta
British Columbia
Manitoba
New Brunswick
Newfoundland and Labrador
Northwest Territories
Nova Scotia
Nunavut
Ontario
Prince Edward Island
Quebec
Saskatchewan
Yukon

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selects a province
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Sign UP button gets active

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicked on the Province drop down and doesn't make a pick
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the error message appears 'You must choose a province to continue'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selects the Province
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the error message disappears 
AND 'Sign Up' button gets enabled
